definition[0]: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a position, duty, or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it
example[0]: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
example[1]: Who will get the Republican nomination for president?
definition[1]: the name of a book, film, actor etc that has been suggested to receive an honour or prize
example[2]: The nominations for the Academy Awards were announced Tuesday.
definition[2]: the act of giving someone a particular job, or the fact of being given that job
example[4]: The film got the nomination for Best Drama.
example[5]: Do you think she has enough votes to win the nomination?
example[6]: He is seeking the Republican nomination in the Senate race.
example[7]: Lieberman accepted the nomination as the vice-presidential candidate.
example[8]: After hostile questioning, he withdrew his nomination to be CIA director.
example[9]: The president makes the nominations of judges for the Supreme Court.
example[10]: Senator Hatch said that he would oppose Lee's nomination to assistant attorney general.
example[11]: The Senate unanimously approved her nomination.
example[12]: He was unsuccessful in his campaign for the presidential nomination in 2008.
example[13]: Feinstein beat Van de Kamp for the Democratic mayoral nomination.
example[14]: The novel has received a National Book Award nomination.
definition[3]: the act of officially suggesting someone for a job, position, or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it
definition[4]: the act of choosing someone for a particular job, or the fact of being chosen
